text: hi welcome to the AWS cost optimization
Series today we're going to talk about
how to save costs on AWS using saving
plans
[Music]
did you know that you can save up to 72
percent on your AWS compute warlocks
with saving plans AWS saving plans are a
pricing model that offers discounted
prices on regular on-demand instances
when you commit to use one or two years
the prices you will pay for usage is the
same through the plan term you can
manage your plans by using
recommendations performance reporting
and budget alerts in AWS cost Explorer
so let's have a look on the console to
access saving plans interface we need to
type on this search bar saving plans
after that we're gonna click here on
saving plans at the bottom of this
bar okay so we're gonna get saving plans
overview
an important thing to remember here is
that we get recommendations from the AWS
cost Management console and
recommendations are based on our past
usage
this is important for you to remember
because AWS is looking to save some
costs for you through these
recommendations
but we can also purchase some saving
plans here we have three saving plan
types the first one is compute saving
plans and this applies to ec2 instances
fargate and AWS Lambda
the second type is easy to install
saving plans and this applies to
instances usage within their committed
ec2 family and region and the last one
is sagemaker saving plans and this
applies to sagemaker service usage
regardless of region instant family and
Company
so for this example you're going to
choose compute saving plans and next we
need to select the term commitment we
can select one year or two years let's
select one year
um next we need to choose an hourly
commitment we can start with one dollar
or less the minimum value is 0.001
and we need to select a payment option
as well we can select all the front
partial front on The Upfront
with all the front we will get more
discount
optionally we can select a start date
for our saving plan but it's not
mandatory
at the bottom of this interface we will
see approaches summary and then we can
add this to the Curve
we can click here on submit order
and that's it we need to wait until this
saving plan is approved by the AWS
thanks for watching I hope you have
learned something new today and see you
in the next video
